author: Rohit Thakur (@rohitthakur2590)
doc.description: This module manages global OSPFv2 configuration on devices running Cisco IOS-XR
notes: This module works with connection C(network_cli). See L(the IOS-XR Platform Options,../network/user_guide/platform_iosxr.html)

config.description: A list of OSPFv2 process configuration

processes.description: A list of OSPFv2 instances configuration

address_family_unicast.description: Enable unicast topology for ipv4 address family

max_adjacency.description: Maximum simultaneous neighbors to bring up

min_adjacency.description: Initial number of neighbors to bring up per area (default 2)

apply_weight.description: Enable weights configured under interfaces for load sharing

bandwidth.description: Reference bandwidth to use for calculation (Mbits/sec)

default_weight.description: Specify default weight value to use when it is not configured under interface

area_id.description: Area ID as IP address or integer

clear.description: Specifies an UNENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

encrypted.description: Specifies an ENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

strict_mode.description: Hold down neighbor session until BFD session is up

dead_interval.description: Interval after which a neighbor is declared dead

default_cost.description: Set the summary default-cost of a NSSA/stub area. Stub's advertised external route metric

traffic_eng.description: Configure an ospf area to run MPLS Traffic Engineering

mtu_ignore.description: Enable/Disable ignoring of MTU in DBD packets

description: NSSA settings for the area

no_redistribution.description: Do not send redistributed LSAs into NSSA area

no_summary.description: Do not send summary LSAs into NSSA area

description: Translate from Type 7 to Type 5
Always translate LSAs

ranges.description: Summarize routes matching address/mask (border routers only)

route_policy.description: Specify the route-policy to filter type 3 LSAs (list can have one inbound and/or one outbound policy only)

parameters.description: Specify parameter values for the policy

description: Settings for configuring the area as a stub
Do not send summary LSA into stub area
Configure the area as a stub

transmit_delay.description: Estimated time needed to send link-state update packet

clear.description: Specifies an UNENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

encrypted.description: Specifies an ENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

dead_interval.description: Interval after which a neighbor is declared dead

clear.description: Specifies an UNENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

encrypted.description: Specifies an ENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

clear.description: Specifies an UNENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

encrypted.description: Specifies an ENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

auto_cost.description: Calculate OSPFv2 interface cost according to bandwidth

disable.description: Assign OSPFv2 cost based on interface type

reference_bandwidth.description: Specify reference bandwidth in megabits per sec

strict_mode.description: Hold down neighbor session until BFD session is up

database_filter.description: Filter OSPFv2 LSA during synchronization and flooding (all outgoing LSA). Enable/Disable filtering

dead_interval.description: Interval after which a neighbor is declared dead

metric_type.description: OSPFv2 metric type for default routes

distribute_bgp_ls.description: Enable Distribution of LSAs to external services

throttle.description: Throttle time between successive LSA updates

distribute_link_state.description: Enable Distribution of LSAs to external services

throttle.description: Throttle time between successive LSA updates

distribute_list.description: Filter networks in routing updates (list can have one inbound and/or one outbound policy only)

outgoing_params.description: Specify additional parameters for outgoing updates only

description: For BGP, specify AS number. 2-byte AS number (or) 4-byte AS number in asdot (X.Y) format (or) 4-byte AS number in asplain format
For OSPF, specify OSPFv2 instance name

route_policy.description: Route Policy to filter OSPFv2 prefixes (for incoming updates only)

external_out.description: Enable/Disable advertisement of intra-area prefixes as external

ignore_lsa_mospf.description: Do not complain upon receiving MOSPFv2 Type 6 LSA

link_down_fast_detect.description: Enable fast or early detection of link-down events

loopback_stub_network.description: Advertise loopback as a stub network

description: Feature to limit the number of non-self-originated LSAs
Set count on how many times adjacencies can be suppressed
Set number of minutes during which all adjacencies are suppressed
Set number of minutes after which ignore-count is reset to zero
Threshold value (%) at which to generate a warning message
Log a warning message when limit is exceeded

max_metric_value.description: Set max metric value for external LSAs

description: Advertise Max metric for Stub links as well
Effective only at startup
Set on-startup attribute
ASN of BGP to wait for
Wait period in seconds after startup
Summary LSAs configuration
Max metric value for summary LSAs
Set summary-lsa attribute

clear.description: Specifies an UNENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

encrypted.description: Specifies an ENCRYPTED password (key) will follow

protected.description: Avoid microloops for protected prefixes only)

rib_update_delay.description: Delay to introduce between SPF and RIB updates

traffic_eng.description: Routing protocol commands for MPLS Traffic Engineering

autoroute_exclude.description: Exclude IP address destinations from using TE tunnels

parameters.description: Specify parameter values for the policy

igp_intact.description: Retain one or more IPv4 nexthops with tunnel nexthops

ldp_sync_update.description: Enable LDP sync induced metric propagation

router_id.description: Traffic Engineering stable IP address for system

mtu_ignore.description: Enable/Disable ignoring of MTU in DBD packets

enforce_global.description: Cancel NSF restart when non-NSF-aware neighbors detected for the whole OSPFv2 process

flush_delay_time.description: Maximum time allowed for external route learning

interval.description: Minimum interval between NSF restarts (<90-3600> seconds)

lifetime.description: Maximum route lifetime following restart (<90-1800> seconds)

nsr.description: Enable NSR for all VRFs in this process. 'False' option to disable NSR for all VRFs in this process

packet_size.description: Size of OSPFv2 packets to use. min=576 max=MTU bytes

host_mode.description: Only traffic destined for this box allowed(cisco-support)

limit.description: High watermark for incoming priority events

high.description: Hello events are dropped when incoming event queue exceeds this value

low.description: DBD/LS Update/Req packets are dropped when incoming event queue exceeds this value

medium.description: LSA ACKs are dropped when incoming event queue exceeds this value

redistribute.description: Redistribute information from another routing Protocol

id.description: OnePK application name for application routes (or) AS number for bgp and eigrp (or) instance name for isis and ospf

match.description: Redistribution of routes. For OSPFv2 - external/internal/nssa-external 1/2. For EIGRP - external/internal

metric_type.description: OSPFv2 exterior metric type for redistributed routes

parameters.description: Specify parameter values for the policy

tag.description: Set tag for routes redistributed into OSPFv2

router_id.description: OSPFv2 router-id in IPv4 address format (A.B.C.D)

hops.description: Maximum number of IP hops allowed <1-254>

summary_in.description: Enable/Disable advertisement of external prefixes as inter-area

not_advertise.description: Suppress routes that match the specified prefix/mask pair

retain_routes.description: Time to keep routes active after graceful shutdown

group_pacing.description: OSPFv2 LSA group pacing timer. Interval between group of LSA being refreshed or maxaged

min_arrival.description: OSPFv2 MinLSArrival timer. The minimum interval in millisec between accepting the same LSA

refresh.description: OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval. How often self-originated LSAs should be refreshed, in seconds

pacing_flood.description: OSPFv2 flood pacing timer. Interval in msec to pace flooding on all interfaces

fast_reroute.description: Fast-reroute throttle timer. Delay between end of SPF and start of the fast-reroute computation in milliseconds

lsa_all.description: LSA throttle timers for all types of OSPFv2 LSAs

initial_delay.description: Delay to generate first occurance of LSA in milliseconds

max_delay.description: Maximum delay between originating the same LSA in milliseconds

min_delay.description: Minimum delay between originating the same LSA in milliseconds

change_delay.description: Delay between receiving a change to SPF calculation in milliseconds

max_wait.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds for SPF calculations

second_delay.description: Delay between first and second SPF calculation in milliseconds

transmit_delay.description: Estimated time needed to send link-state update packet

description: This option is used only with state I(parsed).
The value of this option should be the output received from the IOS-XR device by executing the command B(show running-config router ospf).

The state I(parsed) reads the configuration from C(running_config) option and transforms it into Ansible structured data as per the resource module's argspec and the value is then returned in the I(parsed) key within the result.
The state the configuration should be left in.

cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2.examples:
# Using merged

# Before state:
# -------------
#
# RP/0/RP0/CPU0:anton#show running-config router ospf
# Thu Jun 11 15:54:44.569 UTC
# % No such configuration item(s)
#

- name: Merge provided OSPFv2 configuration with the existing configuration
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    config:
      processes:
      - process_id: '27'
        areas:
        - area_id: '10'
          hello_interval: 2
          authentication:
            keychain: ansi11393
      - process_id: '26'
        adjacency_stagger:
          max_adjacency: 20
          min_adjacency: 10
      - process_id: '10'
        authentication:
          keychain: ansible_test1102
        areas:
        - area_id: '11'
          default_cost: 5
          cost: 11
        - area_id: 22
          default_cost: 6
      - process_id: '30'
        areas:
        - area_id: 11
          default_cost: 5
        - area_id: 22
          default_cost: 6

        cost: 2
        default_metric: 10
        transmit_delay: 2
        hello_interval: 1
        dead_interval: 2
        retransmit_interval: 2
        weight: 2
        packet_size: 577
        priority: 1
        router_id: 2.2.2.2
        demand_circuit: enable
        passive: disable
        summary_in: enable
        flood_reduction: disable
        mtu_ignore: enable
        external_out: disable
    state: merged

#
#
# ------------------------
# Module Execution Result
# ------------------------
#
#  "before": {}
#
#  "commands": [
#        "router ospf 30",
#        "cost 2",
#        "weight 2",
#        "passive disable",
#        "priority 1",
#        "flood-reduction disable",
#        "default-metric 10",
#        "router-id 2.2.2.2",
#        "demand-circuit enable",
#        "packet-size 577",
#        "transmit-delay 2",
#        "summary-in enable",
#        "external-out disable",
#        "dead-interval 2",
#        "hello-interval 1",
#        "retransmit-interval 2",
#        "mtu-ignore enable",
#        "area 11 default-cost 5",

#        "router ospf 26",
#        "adjacency stagger 10 20",
#        "authentication message-digest keychain ansible1101pass",
#        "router ospf 27",

#        "area 10 hello-interval 2",
#        "router ospf 10",
#        "authentication keychain ansible_test1102",
#        "area 11 default-cost 5",
#        "area 11 cost 11",
#        "area 22 default-cost 6"
#    ]
#
#  "after": {
#        "processes": [
#            {
#                "areas": [
#                    {
#                        "area_id": "11",
#                        "cost": 11,
#                        "default_cost": 5
#                    },
#                    {

#                        "default_cost": 6

#   default-cost 6
#  !

- name: Replace OSPFv2 routes configurations from the device
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    config:
      processes:
      - process_id: 27
        areas:
        - area_id: 10
          hello_interval: 2
        - area_id: 20
          cost: 2
          default_cost: 2
          authentication:
            keychain: ansi11393
      - process_id: 26
        adjacency_stagger:
          min_adjacency: 10
          max_adjacency: 20
    state: replaced

#

# Thu Jun 11 16:06:44.406 UTC
# router ospf 10

#   cost 11
#   default-cost 5
#  !
#  area 22

#   hello-interval 2

#  external-out disable
#  cost 2

#  weight 2

#  priority 1
#  mtu-ignore enable
#  flood-reduction disable
#  dead-interval 2
#  retransmit-interval 2
#  demand-circuit enable
#  hello-interval 1
#  transmit-delay 2
#  default-metric 10
#  area 11
#   default-cost 5
#  !
#  area 22
#   default-cost 6
#  !
# !
#

- name: Override existing OSPFv2 configurations from the device
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    config:
      processes:
      - process_id: 27
        areas:
        - area_id: 10
          hello_interval: 2
          authentication:
            keychain: ansi11393
        - area_id: 20
          cost: 2
          default_cost: 2
          authentication:
            keychain: ansi11393
      - process_id: 26
        adjacency_stagger:
          min_adjacency: 10
          max_adjacency: 20
    state: overridden

#
#
# ------------------------
# Module Execution Result
# ------------------------
#
#  "before": {
#        "processes": [

#  area 11
#   default-cost 5
#  !
#  area 22
#   default-cost 6
#  !

- name: Deleted existing OSPFv2 configurations from the device
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    config:
      processes:
      - process_id: '10'
      - process_id: '26'
      - process_id: '27'
      - process_id: '30'
    state: deleted

- name: Parsed the device configuration to get output commands
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    running_config: "{{ lookup('file', './parsed.cfg') }}"
    state: parsed

# Using rendered
#
#
- name: Render the commands for provided  configuration
  cisco.iosxr.iosxr_ospfv2:
    config:
      processes:
      - process_id: 27
        areas:
        - area_id: 10
          hello_interval: 2
          authentication:
            keychain: ansi11393
      - process_id: 26
        adjacency_stagger:
          min_adjacency: 10
          max_adjacency: 20
      - process_id: 10
        authentication:
          keychain: ansible_test1102
        areas:
        - area_id: 11
          default_cost: 5
          cost: 11
        - area_id: 22
          default_cost: 6
      - process_id: 30
        areas:
        - area_id: 11
          default_cost: 5
        - area_id: 22
          default_cost: 6

        cost: 2
        default_metric: 10
        transmit_delay: 2
        hello_interval: 1
        dead_interval: 2
        retransmit_interval: 2
        weight: 2
        packet_size: 577
        priority: 1
        router_id: 2.2.2.2
        demand_circuit: enable
        passive: disable
        summary_in: enable
        flood_reduction: disable
        mtu_ignore: enable
        external_out: disable
    state: rendered

#
#
# -------------------------
# Module Execution Result
# -------------------------
#
#
# "rendered": [

#        "area 10 authentication keychain ansi11393",
#        "area 10 hello-interval 2",
#        "router ospf 26",

after.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

before.description: The configuration prior to the model invocation.
before.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

commands.description: The set of commands pushed to the remote device.
